newsitem.title: USA: U.S. M-2 money supply up $8.4 bln in Dec 23 week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. M-2 money supply up $8.4 bln in Dec 23 week.

text.p: U.S. M-2 money supply rose $8.4 billion in the December 23 week to $3,831.0 billion, the Federal Reserve said.
The broader M-3 measure rose $6.6 billion to $4,899.0 billion. M-1 rose $6.1 billion to $1,079.0 billion, the Fed said.
The Fed said the four-week moving average of M-2 was $3,822.2 billion versus $3,812.6 billion in the previous week.
